TAPAS. TAPAS. TAPAS.  BCN is known for this, and this place really showcases it very well.  Went here for a light lunch, and they sell tapas only! No main courses!  If you opt to sit inside, you will pass by a bar of all the different cold tapas they sell, and they're made very fresh with such complex ingredients and flavors.  Instead of a traditional menu, they have a placemat of all the different tapas they offered both hot and cold.  I want to say there were about 80+ different types ranging from a traditional potato dish to octopus.  Each of the tapas ranged about 1-4 Euros each.  I really enjoy seafood and raw items, so all of my items came from the cold section (pictures attached).  I will say that the price per tapas is a little on the steep side.  You might be wondering why I say that as 1-4 euros doesn't sound like much but the portion is super tiny.  I ordered an octopus skewer, and that already was 3 euros for such small pieces.  It really felt like super mini appetizers and not traditional tapas where you can share with others.  It's definitely a single person thing.
